snippet: The officials, some of whom served under President Obama, urged the U.S. to accept 100,000 Syrian refugees, a tenfold increase over the current commitment.
abstract: Bipartisan group of former American officials implores Pres Obama and Congress in letter to increase its acceptance of Syrian refugees to 100,000 from previous commitment of 10,000 over next year; cites extraordinary circumstances and appeals to past resettlement of refugees to counter skepticism.
lead_paragraph: The officials, some of whom served under President Obama, urged the U.S. to accept 100,000 Syrian refugees, a tenfold increase over the current commitment.
